page.title: 15RECREATION - RETIREMENT
page.content: We came to Keevil because the house offered ground floor accommodation for an 80yr old mother. Before long I was asked to be Treasurer of the PCC. Be- sides preparing accounts, there are bills to be paid, contractors to be seen, estimates obtained and active support given to fund raising events. An invitation to become Secretary of the Village Hall Committee extended to being custodian of keys, general works overseer, poster artist and deputy treasurer with additional respon- sibilities for dealing with heating, lighting and drainage emergencies. I audit the accounts for the Silver Threads (an old peoples group),prepare accounts for the Meals on Wheels organiser, and help to record a quart- erly Physically Handicapped magazine on tape for the blind.I attend monthly meetings of the Gramophone Society.
